quote: If you love someone you should tell ‘em that you love ‘em. Tell ‘em now ‘cause it might be too late. Life is fragile.
author: Diary
description: It's easy to assume there is more time. But when it's gone, the chance to express love may be lost forever.

quote: To have ruined one's self over poetry is an honour.
author: Oscar Wilde
description: The power of art transcends material loss. A true dedication to creativity is worth the sacrifice.

quote: Whatever I hate, isn't real. Whatever I love, I hate.
author: Diary
description: Contradiction is a part of our emotional reality. Love and hate coexist in complex ways that challenge us.

quote: You are the wayshower that you seek.
author: Diary
description: Looking for guidance from others can distract from the inner wisdom that leads to self-discovery.

quote: All I can say is never again, no love, no people, just music.
author: Diary
description: Sometimes, solitude offers the best refuge from heartbreak. Music, a constant companion.

quote: That is not dead which can eternal lie. And with strange aeons even death may die.
author: H.P. Lovecraft
description: The mystery of time and existence is profound. Some truths transcend the boundaries of life and death.

quote: The soul is healed by being with children.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: Innocence and simplicity bring us back to what matters most in life—joy, wonder, and connection.

quote: Happily ever after is a myth because people are not static.
author: Diary
description: Change is constant, and relationships must evolve as people do. True happiness requires flexibility.

quote: Yes, I'm a fan of living some part of each day with my head in the clouds.
author: Diary
description: Daydreaming fosters creativity and offers an escape. Let your mind wander and see where it leads.

quote: Saying you feel disappointed by something you want but maybe can’t have makes you honest.
author: Diary
description: Acknowledging disappointment is part of authenticity. It helps us confront unmet desires and embrace reality.

quote: Man only likes to count his troubles; he doesn't calculate his happiness.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: Humans tend to dwell on difficulties and overlook the joys. Happiness is often found in perspective.

quote: Pain and suffering are always inevitable for a large intelligence and a deep heart.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: The greater your emotional and intellectual depth, the more you feel the weight of life’s sorrows.
